intro: Hemimeris mutisii, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it produces small, fleshy berries that contain toxic compounds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
